author: ituckey
title: Andy Carroll is leaner and fitter than ever and inspiring West Ham back to form…. just as Dimitri Payet leaves
text:
Comments SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 4 
OUR return to form (except against Man City ) coincides with the departure of Dimitri Payet and a rush of goals by Andy Carroll. Reuters 4 Andy Carroll is looking in prime shape and peak form – at the perfect time 
Andy’s leaner and fitter than I’ve ever seen him. His equaliser sets up win over Southampton. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 5 
THE pundits who forecast Leicester would cave in had the wrong season. They got over the line as champions. 
Now, after another depressing defeat, another line is in sight — the one demarcating relegation. PA:Press Association 4 Claudio Ranieri can turn Leicester around after their slump, says Karren Brady 
Against Man Utd , Claudio Ranieri looks like a favourite uncle at a funeral. I hope he leads them to safety. MONDAY, FEBRUARY 6 
THERE is a quite harrowing update on the historical child sex abuse in football. 
It states that there have been 1,016 referrals, 526 individuals who have named 184 potential suspects and 248 clubs implicated, of which 16 are said to be in the Premier League . Dreadful. TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 7 
TIME to move on, mate. 
The advice to John Terry comes from ex- Chelsea captain Marcel Desailly. PA:Press Association 4 John Terry and Frank Lampard are the definition of modern-day Chelsea legends 
Terry , 36, bridges the greatest years at the Blues and with Frank Lampard , they were quite an act. I see Lampard as Sherlock and Terry as Moriarty. THE absurdity of paying a player £31m-a-year has never been better exhibited than by Shanghai Shenhua’s flops. 
Shanghai, who tempted Carlos Tevez by overpaying the 33-year-old scuttling Argie, are KO’d in a qualifying round of the Asian Cup today. Reuters Carlos Tevez seems past his best after a big-money switch to China THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 9 
THAT pensioners’ tea party, the 122-strong FA Council, are told by the Commons they must make a successful effort to recruit more women, ethnic minorities and people with experience in the game. 
It’ll need more than threats of a cut in Government hand-outs to budge them. A couple of cannons might help. FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 10 
TONY PULIS is a spiky Welshman, as he showed last week in a spat with Mark Hughes . But even he’d struggle to pick a row with Slaven Bilic when the pair meet tomorrow. Southampton 1-3 West Ham : Hammers bounce back to beat Saints at St Mary's
